abstract.p: Letter by New York Assemblyman Edward C Sullivan, chairman of Higher Education Committee, rejects Brent Staples' criticism of Democrats; notes he has held nearly 200 meetings and two public hearings on CUNY remediation policies (S)

block.p: Brent Staples (Editorial Observer, Sept. 7) criticizes Democrats in the New York Assembly for being ''perplexingly quiet'' during the controversy over Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's policy to end remediation at the City University of New York's senior colleges.

Brent Staples (Editorial Observer, Sept. 7) criticizes Democrats in the New York Assembly for being ''perplexingly quiet'' during the controversy over Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's policy to end remediation at the City University of New York's senior colleges.

I am appointed by Speaker Sheldon Silver to deal with CUNY and have held nearly 200 meetings and 2 public hearings on the matter. I have testified at two other hearings held by the New York City Council. I have quizzed CUNY officials at the Legislature's financial hearings and have given dozens of interviews.

I wrote the news release presented by the Speaker when several dozen Assembly Democrats joined in denouncing the Mayor's policy. In these efforts, members of the black and Hispanic caucus have been fully supportive and frequently participants.
The writer is chairman, Assembly Committee on Higher Education.
